intro: Oxytropis tschujae, commonly known as the Tschuja locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is considered a noxious weed in some areas.
